nistRequirement: Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources.

settings.description: Requires BitLocker encryption on all drives to prevent unauthorized information transfer from storage media. Protects data at rest and prevents residual data exposure when storage resources are reallocated.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Intune > Devices > Compliance policies > Create Policy
2. Select Windows 10 and later
3. Under Device Health settings, set 'Require BitLocker' to 'Require'
4. Configure Actions for noncompliance (recommend immediate marking as non-compliant)
5. Assign to device groups
6. Deploy encryption policy separately via Endpoint security > Disk encryption to enforce BitLocker

controlMappings.mappingRationale: BitLocker encryption prevents unauthorized access to information stored on shared storage resources. When storage is reallocated, encryption ensures residual data cannot be recovered. This is a CIS Benchmark Level 1 control and Microsoft security baseline requirement for protecting information in shared system resources.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources (storage)

settings.description: Enforces XTS-AES 256-bit encryption for BitLocker to ensure strong cryptographic protection of data at rest. Prevents recovery of information from shared storage resources through cryptanalysis.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Intune > Endpoint security > Disk encryption > Create Policy
2. Select Windows 10 and later > BitLocker
3. Under BitLocker > BitLocker Drive Encryption settings
4. Set 'Encryption Method' to 'XTS-AES 256-bit'
5. Apply to OS drives, fixed drives, and removable drives
6. Configure 'Require device to backup recovery information to Azure AD' to 'Yes'
7. Assign to device groups and deploy

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Strong encryption (XTS-AES 256-bit) ensures that even if storage resources are compromised or reallocated, information cannot be recovered or transferred without proper authorization. Recommended by Microsoft security baselines and meets federal encryption standards.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources

settings.description: Requires UEFI Secure Boot to prevent unauthorized code execution during system boot. Protects boot-time memory and system resources from malicious modification that could enable information transfer attacks.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Intune > Devices > Compliance policies > Create Policy
2. Select Windows 10 and later
3. Under Device Properties, set 'Require Secure Boot to be enabled on the device' to 'Require'
4. Configure Actions for noncompliance
5. Assign to device groups
6. Note: Secure Boot must be enabled in device UEFI/BIOS - compliance policy validates the setting

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Secure Boot validates boot integrity and prevents rootkits that could manipulate shared system resources (memory, storage) to transfer information unauthorized. This is a Windows security baseline requirement and CIS Benchmark control for protecting system resource integrity.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources (boot process integrity)

settings.description: Enables Hypervisor-Protected Code Integrity (HVCI) to isolate kernel memory and prevent manipulation of shared memory resources. Uses virtualization-based security to protect against kernel-level information leakage.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Intune > Endpoint security > Security baselines
2. Select 'Security Baseline for Windows 10 and later'
3. Create new profile or edit existing
4. Under 'Virtualization Based Technology' settings
5. Set 'Hypervisor Enforced Code Integrity' to 'Enabled with UEFI lock'
6. Set 'Enable Virtualization Based Security' to 'Enable'
7. Set 'Require Platform Security Features' to 'Secure Boot and DMA'
8. Assign to device groups and deploy

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Memory Integrity (HVCI) prevents unauthorized kernel memory access and manipulation, directly addressing the requirement to prevent unintended information transfer via shared memory resources. This is a Microsoft security baseline requirement and protects against advanced memory-based attacks.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources (memory)

settings.description: Enables Credential Guard using virtualization-based security to isolate credentials in protected memory. Prevents credential theft from LSASS memory, protecting sensitive information in shared system resources.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Intune > Endpoint security > Account protection
2. Create Policy > Windows 10 and later > Account protection
3. Under Device Guard settings
4. Set 'Turn on Credential Guard' to 'Enable with UEFI lock'
5. Optionally configure via Security baseline under 'Device Guard' section
6. Assign to device groups
7. Devices must meet hardware requirements: TPM 2.0, UEFI, Virtualization support
8. Deploy and verify with msinfo32.exe on endpoints

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Credential Guard uses hardware-based virtualization to isolate credentials in protected memory, preventing unauthorized access to sensitive information stored in shared memory resources (LSASS process). This is a Windows Enterprise security baseline requirement and CIS Benchmark control for protecting credentials in shared system memory.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources (credential memory protection)
